parameters.text:
=You are a validator. You will receive a plain-text LinkedIn job post immediately after this instruction. Do not ask for more input. Read the job post and perform a soft validation. Then output exactly one word: YES or NO (uppercase). Do not output anything else, no explanation, no punctuation, no whitespace, no newline—only the single token YES or NO.

Soft validation rules (be tolerant — case-insensitive, ignore minor whitespace or small wording differences, order may vary, bullets can be • / - / \* ):

Required elements (each must appear somewhere in the text under the tolerance rules):

1. A headline containing the phrase "Hiring Alert" and a job title. If the Experience is 1 year or less or the Experience line is missing, the word "Fresher" must appear in the headline or job title (or be clearly implied by the Experience line).
2. An "Experience:" line with an experience range (for example "0-1 year", "0–1 years", "6 months – 1 year"). If the Experience line is missing or indicates ≤ 1 year, treat as Fresher and require Fresher in the headline as above.
3. A Skills section header (for example "Skills:", "Skills Required:", "Required Skills:") with at least one bullet item beneath it.
4. A Responsibilities section header (for example "Responsibilities:", "Role:", "What you will do:") with at least one bullet item beneath it.
5. A "How to Apply:" line that contains either a valid link (http or https) or an email address.
6. A hashtags line that includes the token "hashtag#Hiring" plus between 1 and 7 additional hashtag# tokens (for example hashtag#BackendDeveloper). Tokens must start with "hashtag#".

Tolerance details:
• Section header variants are acceptable (for example "Skills", "Required Skills", "Skills Required").
• Bullet characters may be "•", "-", or "\*". At least one bullet must exist under Skills and under Responsibilities.
• Allow minor punctuation and capitalization differences.
• Ignore extra sections, company paragraphs, or footer text.
• If Experience is ambiguous, treat missing or clearly ≤ 1 year as Fresher and require "Fresher" in the headline/title.

Failure rules (return NO if any of the following):
• No Skills header or no bullets under Skills.
• No Responsibilities header or no bullets under Responsibilities.
• No "How to Apply:" line with a link or email.
• No hashtags line that includes "hashtag#Hiring".
• Headline does not contain "Hiring Alert" and a job title, or Fresher is required but missing from headline/title.

Validation outcome:
• Return YES if all required elements are present under the tolerance rules.
• Return NO if one or more required elements are missing or obviously malformed.

Now validate the job post that follows (the job post begins on the next line). Output ONLY "YES" or "NO" - {{ $json.output }}

=You are an AI that converts job descriptions into LinkedIn hiring posts in plain text.

Follow these rules:

1. Use this format strictly:

{Hiring Alert – Fresher [Automatically determine a clear, easy-to-understand job title from the JD (e.g., "Frontend Developer", "Data Analyst", "IT Support Engineer") and insert it here]}

Experience: Always display the exact experience range from the JD (e.g., "0–1 years"); if the JD shows 1 year or less or has no experience listed, append " (Fresher)" after the range.

\[Company Name] is looking for a \[Job Title]. ( if [Company Name] not present → skip)

Location: \[Mentioned location in JD, if not present → skip]

Skills Required:
• \[List key skills from JD. If not mentioned, skip]

Responsibilities:
• \[List responsibilities from JD. If not mentioned, skip]

How to Apply: \[Application link provided (In the Bottom there was a apply link)]

hashtag#Hiring hashtag#\[Domain/Role] hashtag#\[Extracted skills/technologies] hashtag#\[Location if mentioned]}

2. Always include **“Fresher”** with the role if required experience is **1 year or less, or not mentioned**.
3. If something is missing in the JD (skills, responsibilities, location, etc.), skip that portion.
4. Extract **Domain/Job Title** from the JD’s skills and responsibilities (e.g., Backend Developer, Data Analyst, IT Support, Digital Marketing).
5. Generate **hashtags dynamically** based on:
   • Role (e.g., hashtag#BackendDeveloper)
   • Skills/technologies (e.g., hashtag#Linux, hashtag#Windows, hashtag#JavaScript)
   • Location (if mentioned, e.g., hashtag#Bangalore)
   • Always include hashtag#Hiring
6. Limit hashtags to **6–8 maximum** to keep the post clean and professional.
7. Keep output in **plain text only** (no markdown, no bold/italic).

---

**Example Input:**
Job Description:
Amazon is looking for a Backend Developer. Location: Bengaluru, Karnataka, India. Experience: 0 to 1 year. Skills: Windows, Linux, IT troubleshooting, ITIL tools. Responsibilities: Provide 24×7 support, follow SOPs, document issues, collaborate globally, participate in shifts.
Link: [https://lnkd.in/gDX8RbxY]

**Example Output:**
Hiring Alert – Fresher Backend Developer

Experience: 0 to 1 year

Amazon is looking for a Backend Developer.

Location: Bengaluru, Karnataka, India

Skills Required:
• Windows and Linux
• IT troubleshooting on desktops and laptops
• ITIL-based ticketing tools

Responsibilities:
• Provide 24×7 support for end-user devices
• Follow SOPs and meet SLA targets
• Document issues and solutions in the system
• Collaborate with global teams
• Participate in rotational shifts

How to Apply: [https://lnkd.in/gDX8RbxY]

hashtag#Hiring hashtag#BackendDeveloper hashtag#ITSupport hashtag#Linux hashtag#Windows hashtag#Bangalore
 -  {{ $json['Job Description'] }}

parameters.text:
=Extract only the company name, job role, and years of experience from the job description text and return in this exact single-line format:

[Company Name] - [Apply Link] - [Job Role] - [Experience Years]

Example: "VAYUZ Technologies - Data Analyst - 1-10 years"

Rules:
- Return only one line in the specified format
- Use " - " (space-dash-space) as separators
- If any information is missing, write "Not specified" for that field
- No additional text, explanations, or formatting

Job Description Text: [{{ $('AI Agent - for JD').item.json.output }}]

=You are an AI that converts job descriptions into LinkedIn hiring posts in plain text.

Follow these rules:

1. Use this format strictly:

{Hiring Alert – Fresher [Automatically determine a clear, easy-to-understand job title from the JD (e.g., "Frontend Developer", "Data Analyst", "IT Support Engineer") and insert it here]}

\[Company Name] is looking for a \[Job Title]. ( if [Company Name] not present → skip)

Location: \[Mentioned location in JD, if not present → skip]

Skills Required:
• \[List key skills from JD. If not mentioned, skip]

Responsibilities:
• \[List responsibilities from JD. If not mentioned, skip]

How to Apply: \[Application link provided (In the Bottom there was a apply link)]

hashtag#Hiring hashtag#\[Domain/Role] hashtag#\[Extracted skills/technologies] hashtag#\[Location if mentioned]}

2. Always include **“Fresher”** with the role if required experience is **1 year or less, or not mentioned**.
3. If something is missing in the JD (skills, responsibilities, location, etc.), skip that portion.
4. Extract **Domain/Job Title** from the JD’s skills and responsibilities (e.g., Backend Developer, Data Analyst, IT Support, Digital Marketing).
5. Generate **hashtags dynamically** based on:
   • Role (e.g., hashtag#BackendDeveloper)
   • Skills/technologies (e.g., hashtag#Linux, hashtag#Windows, hashtag#JavaScript)
   • Location (if mentioned, e.g., hashtag#Bangalore)
   • Always include hashtag#Hiring
6. Limit hashtags to **6–8 maximum** to keep the post clean and professional.
7. Keep output in **plain text only** (no markdown, no bold/italic).

---

**Example Input:**

Amazon is looking for a Backend Developer. Location: Bengaluru, Karnataka, India. Experience: 0 to 1 year. Skills: Windows, Linux, IT troubleshooting, ITIL tools. Responsibilities: Provide 24×7 support, follow SOPs, document issues, collaborate globally, participate in shifts.
Link: [https://lnkd.in/gDX8RbxY]

**Example Output:**
Hiring Alert – Fresher Backend Developer

Experience: 0 to 1 year

Amazon is looking for a Backend Developer.

Location: Bengaluru, Karnataka, India

Skills Required:
• Windows and Linux
• IT troubleshooting on desktops and laptops
• ITIL-based ticketing tools

Responsibilities:
• Provide 24×7 support for end-user devices
• Follow SOPs and meet SLA targets
• Document issues and solutions in the system
• Collaborate with global teams
• Participate in rotational shifts

How to Apply: [https://lnkd.in/gDX8RbxY]

hashtag#Hiring hashtag#BackendDeveloper hashtag#ITSupport hashtag#Linux hashtag#Windows hashtag#Bangalore
 -  {{ $('SN-Loop').item.json["Job Description"] }}

Then output exactly one word: YES or NO (uppercase). Do not output anything else, no explanation, no punctuation, no whitespace, no newline—only the single token YES or NO.
